name: Kepler-403
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-403 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-403 is a star with 1.7299999999999989 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.33 times its radius. It is located 2807.97 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-403 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-403 b

Kepler-403 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.08 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 7.03 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-403.

The mass of Kepler-403 b is 1.66 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-403 b is 1.25 that of Earth. At 1.66 Earth masses, Kepler-403 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-403 c

Kepler-403 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.30 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 54.28 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-403.

The mass of Kepler-403 c is 3.68 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-403 c is 1.75 that of Earth. At 3.68 Earth masses, Kepler-403 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-403, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
